latest_videos.video_title: Alphablocks - Letter Teams | Level 3 Yellow - S3 E23 2/3 'Fair'
latest_videos.video_description:
For our FULL 'Letter Teams' course (level 3, yellow), click here: 
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLSW2D61TnopTX8Wxml-dVonj_4m4sIG0C

---

Level three introduces children to letter teams ‚àí two letters that join to make one sound, such as sh and ch, oo and ee. These are also known as digraphs. And they meet three-letter teams, such as igh and air ‚àí also known as trigraphs.

---

Alphablocks is a step-by-step reading programme grouped neatly into five colour-coded levels. Each level introduces new letters and letter teams along with new phonics ideas and key skills. Alphablocks uses best-practice systematic synthetic phonics developed with literacy experts and aligned to the EYSF (Early Years Foundation Stage) framework and KS1 curriculum. It is compatible with all major UK reading schemes and has helped millions of young children around the world to learn to read.

latest_videos.video_title: Alphablocks - Phonics First Steps | Level 1, Red -  S2 E17 'Lips'
latest_videos.video_description:
For our FULL 'Phonics First Steps' course, click here: 
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLSW2D61TnopSi2X7Fl9QvoYmllUbcEI9Q

---

Level one is about getting to know the letters of the alphabet and the sounds that they make. Children need to learn to recognise the letters they see, say their sounds and to hear them in words. The letters are introduced in an order that allows children to start building words right away, using sounding out and blending skills: they say the sound that each letter makes and blend them together to make words. Children can also begin to master the skill of segmenting, which is breaking words they hear into their separate letter sounds.

Alphablocks is a step-by-step reading programme grouped neatly into five colour-coded levels. Each level introduces new letters and letter teams along with new phonics ideas and key skills. Alphablocks uses best-practice systematic synthetic phonics developed with literacy experts and aligned to the EYSF (Early Years Foundation Stage) framework and KS1 curriculum. It is compatible with all major UK reading schemes and has helped millions of young children around the world to learn to read.

latest_videos.video_title: Alphablocks - Long Vowels | Level 5, Blue - S4 E13 'Cowboy'
latest_videos.video_description:
For our FULL 'Long Vowels' course (level 5, blue), click here: 
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLSW2D61TnopQnwlqbqHI4aIqysGpVuWtk

---

Level five is a big step ‚àí time to discover that there are different ways to make the long vowel sounds. We meet Magic E, who shows how split digraphs work: a vowel and e combine to make the long vowel sound (such as a-e in cake and o-e in home). And children complete their journey from meeting the alphabet to reading words like 'alphabet' with confidence.

Alphablocks is a step-by-step reading programme grouped neatly into five colour-coded levels. Each level introduces new letters and letter teams along with new phonics ideas and key skills. latest_videos.video_title: Alphablocks - Letter Blends | Level 4, Green - S4 E4 'Plusman'
latest_videos.video_description:
For our FULL 'Letter Blends' course (level 4, green), click here: 
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLSW2D61TnopQdrbBjwUDyN7HPLpa42Ea3

---

Level four is all about consonant clusters ‚àí commonly used runs of letters that can speed up reading when children learn to spot them. Clusters can be at the start of a word, such st- in star and stag or tr- in tree and tram. They can be at the end, such as -nd in band or -mp in bump. Sometimes clusters appear at the start and end of words such as the bl- and -nd in blend. Children also meet three letter clusters, such as spl- and str-

popular_videos.video_title: Alphablocks - Letter Blends | Level 4, Green - S4 E4 'Plusman'
popular_videos.video_description:
For our FULL 'Letter Blends' course (level 4, green), click here: 
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLSW2D61TnopQdrbBjwUDyN7HPLpa42Ea3

---

Level four is all about consonant clusters ‚àí commonly used runs of letters that can speed up reading when children learn to spot them. Clusters can be at the start of a word, such st- in star and stag or tr- in tree and tram. They can be at the end, such as -nd in band or -mp in bump. Sometimes clusters appear at the start and end of words such as the bl- and -nd in blend. Children also meet three letter clusters, such as spl- and str-

Alphablocks is a step-by-step reading programme grouped neatly into five colour-coded levels. Each level introduces new letters and letter teams along with new phonics ideas and key skills. Alphablocks uses best-practice systematic synthetic phonics developed with literacy experts and aligned to the EYSF (Early Years Foundation Stage) framework and KS1 curriculum. It is compatible with all major UK reading schemes and has helped millions of young children around the world to learn to read.

popular_videos.video_title: Alphablocks - Phonics First Steps | Level 1, Red - S2 E13 'Hill'
popular_videos.video_description:
For our FULL 'Phonics First Steps' course, click here: 
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLSW2D61TnopSi2X7Fl9QvoYmllUbcEI9Q

---

Level one is about getting to know the letters of the alphabet and the sounds that they make. Children need to learn to recognise the letters they see, say their sounds and to hear them in words. The letters are introduced in an order that allows children to start building words right away, using sounding out and blending skills: they say the sound that each letter makes and blend them together to make words. Children can also begin to master the skill of segmenting, which is breaking words they hear into their separate letter sounds.

Alphablocks is a step-by-step reading programme grouped neatly into five colour-coded levels. Each level introduces new letters and letter teams along with new phonics ideas and key skills. Alphablocks uses best-practice systematic synthetic phonics developed with literacy experts and aligned to the EYSF (Early Years Foundation Stage) framework and KS1 curriculum. It is compatible with all major UK reading schemes and has helped millions of young children around the world to learn to read.

---

Level one is about getting to know the letters of the alphabet and the sounds that they make. Children need to learn to recognise the letters they see, say their sounds and to hear them in words. The letters are introduced in an order that allows children to start building words right away, using sounding out and blending skills: they say the sound that each letter makes and blend them together to make words. Children can also begin to master the skill of segmenting, which is breaking words they hear into their separate letter sounds.

Alphablocks is a step-by-step reading programme grouped neatly into five colour-coded levels. Each level introduces new letters and letter teams along with new phonics ideas and key skills. And children complete their journey from meeting the alphabet to reading words like 'alphabet' with confidence.

short_videos.video_title: Alphablocks - Letter Blends | Level 4, Green - S4 E4 'Plusman'
short_videos.video_description:

https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLSW2D61TnopQdrbBjwUDyN7HPLpa42Ea3

---

Level four is all about consonant clusters ‚àí commonly used runs of letters that can speed up reading when children learn to spot them. Clusters can be at the start of a word, such st- in star and stag or tr- in tree and tram. They can be at the end, such as -nd in band or -mp in bump. Sometimes clusters appear at the start and end of words such as the bl- and -nd in blend. Children also meet three letter clusters, such as spl- and str-

recommended_videos.title: Alphablocks - Phonics First Steps | Level 1, Red - S2 E13 'Hill'
recommended_videos.description:
For our FULL 'Phonics First Steps' course, click here: 
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLSW2D61TnopSi2X7Fl9QvoYmllUbcEI9Q

---

Level one is about getting to know the letters of the alphabet and the sounds that they make. Children need to learn to recognise the letters they see, say their sounds and to hear them in words. The letters are introduced in an order that allows children to start building words right away, using sounding out and blending skills: they say the sound that each letter makes and blend them together to make words. Children can also begin to master the skill of segmenting, which is breaking words they hear into their separate letter sounds.

Alphablocks is a step-by-step reading programme grouped neatly into five colour-coded levels. Each level introduces new letters and letter teams along with new phonics ideas and key skills. Alphablocks uses best-practice systematic synthetic phonics developed with literacy experts and aligned to the EYSF (Early Years Foundation Stage) framework and KS1 curriculum. It is compatible with all major UK reading schemes and has helped millions of young children around the world to learn to read.

What if the alphabet came to life?

Who better to show you how words work than the letters of the alphabet themselves? Alphablocks is the hit CBeebies TV show that‚Äôs helped millions of children learn to read through adventures, songs and laughter. It‚Äôs a ton of fun with letters and words ‚Äì all built on a firm foundation of key phonics skills.

BAFTA-nominated Alphablocks helps children to learn to read - mastering phonics, blending and reading skills with each new episode! It‚Äôs a story of 26 friends who have fun making word magic.

Every episode has been carefully crafted with the help of literacy experts to ensure a best-practice approach to phonics ‚àí and lovingly brought to life by multi-award-winning Blue Zoo Animation Studio. Get ready for an animated adventure that can take your child all the way from their ABCs to reading with confidence.

Alphablocks is designed so your child can just press play and have fun while learning essential phonics skills. More than 80 episodes take them from learning their alphabet to reading long words like 'alphabet'!

recommended_videos.description:
For our FULL 'Phonics Next Steps' course, click here: 
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLSW2D61TnopQyHw1gE-EkwI4CODw__0sk

---

Level two is all about consolidation. It's a time to practice all the skills learned in level one and make sure that they are really secure before proceeding. This level rounds out children's knowledge of the alphabet, introducing letter names (A's name sounds like the a in ape, while her sound is like the start of apple) and capital letters.

Alphablocks is a step-by-step reading programme grouped neatly into five colour-coded levels. Each level introduces new letters and letter teams along with new phonics ideas and key skills. Alphablocks uses best-practice systematic synthetic phonics developed with literacy experts and aligned to the EYSF (Early Years Foundation Stage) framework and KS1 curriculum. It is compatible with all major UK reading schemes and has helped millions of young children around the world to learn to read.

What if the alphabet came to life?

Who better to show you how words work than the letters of the alphabet themselves? Alphablocks is the hit CBeebies TV show that‚Äôs helped millions of children learn to read through adventures, songs and laughter. It‚Äôs a ton of fun with letters and words ‚Äì all built on a firm foundation of key phonics skills.

BAFTA-nominated Alphablocks helps children to learn to read - mastering phonics, blending and reading skills with each new episode! It‚Äôs a story of 26 friends who have fun making word magic.

Every episode has been carefully crafted with the help of literacy experts to ensure a best-practice approach to phonics ‚àí and lovingly brought to life by multi-award-winning Blue Zoo Animation Studio. Get ready for an animated adventure that can take your child all the way from their ABCs to reading with confidence.

Alphablocks is designed so your child can just press play and have fun while learning essential phonics skills. More than 80 episodes take them from learning their alphabet to reading long words like 'alphabet'!

recommended_videos.description:

https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLSW2D61TnopQdrbBjwUDyN7HPLpa42Ea3

---

Level four is all about consonant clusters ‚àí commonly used runs of letters that can speed up reading when children learn to spot them. Clusters can be at the start of a word, such st- in star and stag or tr- in tree and tram. They can be at the end, such as -nd in band or -mp in bump. Sometimes clusters appear at the start and end of words such as the bl- and -nd in blend. Children also meet three letter clusters, such as spl- and str-
